Overview

 

Maryland state government information is increasingly available on the Web.  There is also an important collection of print Maryland state publications in the Maryland Room in Hornbake Library.

Maryland State Publications Depository and Distribution Program

  • Maryland State Publications Depository and Distribution Program
    The Maryland State Publications Depository and Distribution Program (SPDDP) is located at the Enoch Pratt Free Library in Baltimore.

Maryland Government Web Sites

  • Maryland.gov
    Home page for the State of Maryland government.

Some of the most useful Maryland Government Web sites are listed here.

See the Maryland Law Resources guide for more information on Maryland legal resources; see the Maryland Statistics guide for statistics information.

  • County Governments
    Click on the name of the county or on the map to link to Maryland county government Web sites.
  • Municipalities in Maryland
    Click on Directory of Municipal Officials. From here you will be able to link to municipality Web sites.
  • Maryland General Assembly
    The Web site of the Maryland legislature includes many state publications available in pdf.
  • Maryland State Law Library
    Excellent resource for legal information in Maryland
  • Maryland State Archives
  • Maryland Judiciary
    The Web site of the Maryland Judiciary.

The Maryland Room

Located on the first floor of Hornbake Library North, the Maryland Room serves as the reading room for Special Collections and University Archives. All materials from our collections must be viewed in the reading room.

The Maryland Room is open to University of Maryland students, faculty, and staff; faculty, students, and staff from other colleges and universities; local, national, and international scholars; and members of the general public. You do not need an appointment to view materials in the Maryland Room.  

Materials accessed in the Maryland Room are only available to view in the reading room, and do not circulate.  For directions, hours, and other information, please visit the Maryland Room homepage.
